definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: It is well known that accretion disks are hydrodynamic disks with anomalous viscosity.
sentences.chinese: 天体物理吸积盘是具有反常粘滞的流体盘。

sentences.english: Second, we study the stability in the inviscid adiabatic limit.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我们研究无粘滞的绝热吸积流。

sentences.english: Finally, we study the standing shocks in viscous flows.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我们研究有粘滞的吸积流。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, astrophysicists have persisted in their belief that accretion disks are indeed turbulent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然如此，天文物理学家仍旧坚持信念，认为吸积。

sentences.english: The structure and radiation of geometrically thick accretion disk of QSOs with magnetic field are discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论了具有磁场的几何厚吸积盘结构和辐射。

sentences.english: Accreting black hole binaries are important objects to learn black hole physics.
sentences.chinese: 吸积黑洞双星是认识黑洞物理的最重要目标之一。

sentences.english: The energy release can make accretion disks formidable power sources .
sentences.chinese: 此能量释放使吸积盘成为巨大能量的来源。
